channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Plagued by technical issues, Trump-Musk interview on X gets off to a rocky start
item.description: A much-touted interview between former President Donald Trump and X owner Elon Musk got off to a rocky start Monday night after a technical delay before going into politics as usual.
item.content:encoded:
A much-touted interview between former President Donald Trump and X owner Elon Musk got off to a rocky start Monday night after a technical delay before going into politics as usual.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: A pro-Kamala group shows not all Christian voters are conservative white evangelicals
item.description: A group of supporters of Vice President Kamala Harris hopes to rally Christian voters around her campaign and bring together moderate and progressive Christians.
item.content:encoded: A group of supporters of Vice President Kamala Harris hopes to rally Christian voters around her campaign and bring together moderate and progressive Christians.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Vance, Walz and military service
item.description: JD Vance pounced on a comment from Tim Walz to accuse him of “stolen valor." There’s a history of playing politics with military service – one that we’ve seen in past elections.
item.content:encoded: JD Vance pounced on a comment from Tim Walz to accuse him of “stolen valor." There’s a history of playing politics with military service – one that we’ve seen in past elections.
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence

item.title: FBI is investigating after Trump campaign says Iran hacked sensitive documents
item.description: The FBI said Monday it is investigating allegations that sensitive documents from the Trump campaign were stolen in a cyber intrusion days after the campaign declared it had been hacked by Iran.
item.content:encoded:
The FBI said Monday it is investigating allegations that sensitive documents from the Trump campaign were stolen in a cyber intrusion days after the campaign declared it had been hacked by Iran.

(Image credit: Rick Bowmer)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Mpox outbreak grows in Africa
item.description: On Tuesday, it's expected that Africa CDC will announce that Mpox is a health emergency of "continental" concern. An outbreak in the DRC has spread to four countries that have never had Mpox.
item.content:encoded: On Tuesday, it's expected that Africa CDC will announce that Mpox is a health emergency of "continental" concern. An outbreak in the DRC has spread to four countries that have never had Mpox.
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: Bangladesh in the new era
item.description: A week after Bangladesh's long-time leader, Sheikh Hasina, was deposed, there's a sense of cautious optimism in the capital of Khaka as the interim government begins rebuilding the nation.
item.content:encoded: A week after Bangladesh's long-time leader, Sheikh Hasina, was deposed, there's a sense of cautious optimism in the capital of Khaka as the interim government begins rebuilding the nation.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: The search for solutions for managing campus overdose risk
item.description: As overdose kills more young people, some colleges and students are finding ways to better respond. A group is organizing students on 28 campuses to distribute and use Narcan.
item.content:encoded: As overdose kills more young people, some colleges and students are finding ways to better respond. A group is organizing students on 28 campuses to distribute and use Narcan.
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: Earthquakes of the same magnitude can feel different. Here’s why
item.description: Distance from the epicenter, the kind of soil in your area and even the building you're in can determine how you experience an earthquake.
item.content:encoded:
Distance from the epicenter, the kind of soil in your area and even the building you're in can determine how you experience an earthquake.

(Image credit: Ryan Sun)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: With the Games complete, we reflect on the Paris Olympics
item.description: The Games in Paris came to an end last night with a closing ceremony that featured music, acrobats and Tom Cruise rappelling into the stadium among many other elements.
item.content:encoded: The Games in Paris came to an end last night with a closing ceremony that featured music, acrobats and Tom Cruise rappelling into the stadium among many other elements.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: As new school year begins, college campuses brace for unrest over Israel-Hamas war
item.description: College campuses around the nation are bracing for more unrest over the Israel-Hamas war. This summer, student organizers are rethinking tactics, as are counter-protesters and college administrators.
item.content:encoded: College campuses around the nation are bracing for more unrest over the Israel-Hamas war. This summer, student organizers are rethinking tactics, as are counter-protesters and college administrators.
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith
